function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Long-term exposure to raised indoor temperature and humidity can result in severe sick building syndrome (SBS) symptoms.","Impact":"Decreased human health and social wellbeing, decreased working productivity.","Mitigation":"Improving indoor environmental quality (IEQ) through better air circulation, temperature control, and humidity management.","Technologies":"HVAC systems, air purifiers, humidity control devices.","People":"Occupants of indoor spaces.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers."},{"Description":"Indoor air pollutants causing annual loss of disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) and economic losses.","Impact":"Impaired human health, economic losses.","Mitigation":"Enhanced indoor air quality monitoring and control, reduction of indoor air pollutants.","Technologies":"High-efficiency air filters, air quality monitoring devices, ventilation systems.","People":"Residents, workers, and visitors in indoor spaces.","Owner":"Building owners, environmental health professionals."},{"Description":"Traditional IEQ monitoring protocol involving high-cost, invasive environmental sensors with limited spatial dimension and data storage.","Impact":"Limited popularity of IEQ measurements, high cost, invasive assembly.","Mitigation":"Development of cost-effective, non-invasive IEQ monitoring tools with wider spatial coverage and remote data storage.","Technologies":"Wireless environmental sensors, IoT-based monitoring systems, data analytics platforms.","People":"Environmental health professionals, building owners, facility managers.","Owner":"Technology developers, manufacturers, and researchers."}]}
